info: Set a default character name that will be used instead of a random name on character creation.
name: DEF_CHAR_NAME

info: Enable item auto pickup.  Change pickup rules with the Auto Pickup Manager.
name: AUTO_PICKUP

info: If true, will enable to pickup items one tile around to the player.  You can assign No Auto Pickup zones with the Zones Manager 'Y' key for e.g.  your homebase.
name: AUTO_PICKUP_ADJACENT

info: Auto pickup items with weight less than or equal to [option] * 50 grams.  You must also set the small items option.  '0' disables this option
name: AUTO_PICKUP_WEIGHT_LIMIT

info: Auto pickup items with volume less than or equal to [option] * 50 milliliters.  You must also set the light items option.  '0' disables this option
name: AUTO_PICKUP_VOL_LIMIT

info: Auto pickup is disabled as long as you can see monsters nearby.  This is affected by 'Safe Mode proximity distance'.
name: AUTO_PICKUP_SAFEMODE

info: If false, you will not see messages about items, you step on, within no auto pickup zones.
name: NO_AUTO_PICKUP_ZONES_LIST_ITEMS

info: If true, enables configured auto features below.  Disabled as long as any enemy monster is seen.
name: AUTO_FEATURES

info: Action to perform when 'Auto pulp or butcher' is enabled.  Pulp: Pulp corpses you stand on.  - Pulp Adjacent: Also pulp corpses adjacent from you.  - Butcher: Butcher corpses you stand on.
default: Default: off - Values: off, pulp, pulp_adjacent, butcher
name: AUTO_PULP_BUTCHER

info: If true, enables automatic use of wielded pickaxes and jackhammers whenever trying to move into mineable terrain.
name: AUTO_MINING

info: Action to perform when 'Auto foraging' is enabled.  Bushes: Only forage bushes.  - Trees: Only forage trees.  - Everything: Forage bushes, trees, and everything else including flowers, cattails etc.
default: Default: off - Values: off, bushes, trees, both
name: AUTO_FORAGING

info: If false, will cause player to drop new items that cause them to exceed the weight limit.
name: DANGEROUS_PICKUPS

info: Always: You will be prompted to move onto dangerous tiles.  Running: You will only be able to move onto dangerous tiles while running and will be prompted.  Crouching: You will only be able to move onto a dangerous tile while crouching and will be prompted.  Never:  You will not be able to move onto a dangerous tile unless running and will not be warned or prompted.
default: Default: ALWAYS - Values: ALWAYS, RUNNING, CROUCHING, NEVER
name: DANGEROUS_TERRAIN_WARNING_PROMPT

info: If true, will hold the game and display a warning if a hostile monster/npc is approaching.
name: SAFEMODE

info: If safe mode is enabled, distance to hostiles at which safe mode should show a warning.  0 = Max player view distance.  This option only has effect when no safe mode rule is specified.  Otherwise, edit the default rule in Safe Mode Manager instead of this value.
name: SAFEMODEPROXIMITY

info: When true, safe mode will alert you of hostiles while you are driving a vehicle.
name: SAFEMODEVEH

info: If true, safe mode will automatically reactivate after a certain number of turns.  See option 'Turns to auto reactivate safe mode.'
name: AUTOSAFEMODE

info: Number of turns after which safe mode is reactivated.  Will only reactivate if no hostiles are in 'Safe mode proximity distance.'
name: AUTOSAFEMODETURNS

info: Number of turns an ignored monster stays ignored after it is no longer seen.  0 disables this option and monsters are permanently ignored.
name: SAFEMODEIGNORETURNS

info: If enabled, monsters will take periodic gameplay turns.  This value is the delay between each turn, in seconds.  Works best with Safe Mode disabled.  0 = disabled.
name: TURN_DURATION

info: If true, game will periodically save the map.  Autosaves occur based on in-game turns or real-time minutes, whichever is larger.
name: AUTOSAVE

info: Number of game turns between autosaves
name: AUTOSAVE_TURNS

info: Number of real time minutes between autosaves
name: AUTOSAVE_MINUTES

info: If true, automatically sets notes
name: AUTO_NOTES

info: If true, automatically sets notes on places that have stairs that go up or down
name: AUTO_NOTES_STAIRS

info: If true, automatically sets notes on places that contain various map extras
name: AUTO_NOTES_MAP_EXTRAS

info: If true, the game will calculate range in a realistic way: light sources will be circles, diagonal movement will cover more ground and take longer.  If disabled, everything is square: moving to the northwest corner of a building takes as long as moving to the north wall.
name: CIRCLEDIST

info: Set to drop empty containers after use.  No: Don't drop any.  - Watertight: All except watertight containers.  - All: Drop all containers.
default: Default: no - Values: no, watertight, all
name: DROP_EMPTY

info: Always: Always start deathcam.  Ask: Query upon death.  Never: Never show deathcam.
default: Default: ask - Values: always, ask, never
name: DEATHCAM

info: If true, music and sound are enabled.
name: SOUND_ENABLED

info: Choose the soundpack you want to use.  Requires restart.
name: SOUNDPACKS

info: Adjust the volume of the music being played in the background.
name: MUSIC_VOLUME

info: Adjust the volume of sound effects being played by the game.
name: SOUND_EFFECT_VOLUME

info: Adjust the volume of ambient sounds being played by the game.
name: AMBIENT_SOUND_VOLUME

info: Switch Language.
default: Default:  - Values: en, de, es_AR, es_ES, fr, hu, ja, ko, pl, pt_BR, ru, zh_CN, zh_TW
name: USE_LANG

info: Switch between Celsius, Fahrenheit and Kelvin.
default: Default: fahrenheit - Values: fahrenheit, celsius, kelvin
name: USE_CELSIUS

info: Switch between mph, km/h and tiles/turn.
default: Default: mph - Values: mph, km/h, t/t
name: USE_METRIC_SPEEDS

info: Switch between kg and lbs.
name: USE_METRIC_WEIGHTS

info: Switch between the Cup ( c ), Liter ( L ) or Quart ( qt ).
default: Default: l - Values: c, l, qt
name: VOLUME_UNITS

info: 12h: AM/PM, e.g. 7:31 AM - Military: 24h Military, e.g. 0731 - 24h: Normal 24h, e.g. 7:31
name: 24_HOUR

info: If true, Y/N prompts are case-sensitive and y and n are not accepted.
name: FORCE_CAPITAL_YN

info: If true, automatically follow the crosshair when firing/throwing.
name: SNAP_TO_TARGET

info: If true, will query before disassembling items while butchering.
name: QUERY_DISASSEMBLE

info: If true, will query before removing a keybinding from a hotkey.
name: QUERY_KEYBIND_REMOVAL

info: If true, will close the advanced inventory when the move all items command is used.
name: CLOSE_ADV_INV

info: Open default advanced inventory layout instead of last opened layout
name: OPEN_DEFAULT_ADV_INV

info: If true, actions ( like "Read", "Smoke", "Wrap tighter" ) will be displayed next to the corresponding items.
name: INV_USE_ACTION_NAMES

info: If true, directional actions ( like "Examine", "Open", "Pickup" ) will autoselect an adjacent tile if there is exactly one valid target.
name: AUTOSELECT_SINGLE_VALID_TARGET

info: Allows diagonal movement with cursor keys using CTRL and SHIFT modifiers.  Diagonal movement action keys are taken from keybindings, so you need these to be configured.
default: Default: none - Values: none, mode1, mode2, mode3
name: DIAG_MOVE_WITH_MODIFIERS_MODE

info: If true, vehicle parts will change color if they are armor plated
name: VEHICLE_ARMOR_COLOR

info: If true, view will automatically shift towards the driving direction
name: DRIVING_VIEW_OFFSET

info: If true, when controlling a vehicle, a white 'X' ( in curses version ) or a crosshair ( in tiles version ) at distance 10 from the center will display its current facing.
name: VEHICLE_DIR_INDICATOR

info: If true, when driving a vehicle in reverse, steering should also reverse like real life.
name: REVERSE_STEERING

info: Switch between sidebar on the left or on the right side.  Requires restart.
name: SIDEBAR_POSITION

info: If true, adds an extra space between sidebar panels.
name: SIDEBAR_SPACERS

info: Where new log messages should show.
name: LOG_FLOW

info: Number of turns after which a message will be removed from the sidebar log.  '0' disables this option.
name: MESSAGE_TTL

info: Number of turns during which similar messages are hidden.  '0' disables this option.
name: MESSAGE_COOLDOWN

info: If true, pressing a key with no set function will not display a notice in the chat log.
name: NO_UNKNOWN_COMMAND_MSG

info: Switch between pickup panel being left, right, or overlapping the sidebar.
default: Default: left - Values: left, right, overlapping
name: PICKUP_POSITION

info: How should confidence and steadiness be communicated to the player.
name: ACCURACY_DISPLAY

info: Morale display style in sidebar.
name: MORALE_STYLE

info: If true, Advanced Inventory Manager menu will fit full screen, otherwise it will leave sidebar visible.
name: AIM_WIDTH

info: Move view by how many squares per keypress.
name: MOVE_VIEW_OFFSET

info: With Fast Scroll option enabled, shift view on the overmap and while looking around by this many squares per keypress.
name: FAST_SCROLL_OFFSET

info: If true, menus will start scrolling in the center of the list, and keep the list centered.
name: MENU_SCROLL

info: Centered or to edge, shift the view toward the selected item if it is outside of your current viewport.
default: Default: centered - Values: false, centered, edge
name: SHIFT_LIST_ITEM_VIEW

info: Enabled: automatically assign letters to any carried items that lack them.  Disabled: do not auto-assign letters.  Favorites: only auto-assign letters to favorited items.
default: Default: favorites - Values: disabled, enabled, favorites
name: AUTO_INV_ASSIGN

info: If true, show item health bars instead of reinforced, scratched etc. text.
name: ITEM_HEALTH_BAR

info: If true, show item symbols in inventory and pick up menu.
name: ITEM_SYMBOLS

info: If true, the default ammo is added to weapon and magazine names.  For example "Mosin-Nagant M44 (4/5)" becomes "Mosin-Nagant M44 (4/5 7.62x54mm)".
name: AMMO_IN_NAMES

info: Enable input from joystick.
name: ENABLE_JOYSTICK

info: Show: Cursor is always shown.  Hide: Cursor is hidden.  HideKB: Cursor is hidden on keyboard input and unhidden on mouse movement.
default: Default: show - Values: show, hide, hidekb
name: HIDE_CURSOR

info: Edge scrolling with the mouse.
name: EDGE_SCROLL

info: If true, will display enabled animations.
name: ANIMATIONS

info: If true, will display weather animations.
name: ANIMATION_RAIN

info: If true, will display animations for projectiles like bullets, arrows, and thrown items.
name: ANIMATION_PROJECTILES

info: If true, will display scrolling combat text animations.
name: ANIMATION_SCT

info: If true, will display scrolling combat text with Unicode font.
name: ANIMATION_SCT_USE_FONT

info: The amount of time to pause between animation frames in ms.
name: ANIMATION_DELAY

info: If true, forces the game to redraw at least once per turn.
name: FORCE_REDRAW

info: Set the size of the terminal along the X axis.  Requires restart.
name: TERMINAL_X

info: Set the size of the terminal along the Y axis.  Requires restart.
name: TERMINAL_Y

info: If true, fonts will look better.
name: FONT_BLENDING

info: Set the font width.  Requires restart.
name: FONT_WIDTH

info: Set the font height.  Requires restart.
name: FONT_HEIGHT

info: Set the font size.  Requires restart.
name: FONT_SIZE

info: Set the map font width.  Requires restart.
name: MAP_FONT_WIDTH

info: Set the map font height.  Requires restart.
name: MAP_FONT_HEIGHT

info: Set the map font size.  Requires restart.
name: MAP_FONT_SIZE

info: Set the overmap font width.  Requires restart.
name: OVERMAP_FONT_WIDTH

info: Set the overmap font height.  Requires restart.
name: OVERMAP_FONT_HEIGHT

info: Set the overmap font size.  Requires restart.
name: OVERMAP_FONT_SIZE

info: Use SDL ASCII line drawing routine instead of Unicode Line Drawing characters.  Use this option when your selected font doesn't contain necessary glyphs.
name: USE_DRAW_ASCII_LINES_ROUTINE

info: When available item description will show a picture of the item in ascii art.
name: ENABLE_ASCII_ART_ITEM

info: If true, replaces some TTF rendered text with tiles.
name: USE_TILES

info: Choose the tileset you want to use.
default: Default: retrodays - Values: ASCIITiles, brownlikebears, ChestHole16, HitButton_iso, hoder, UNDEAD_PEOPLE, retrodays+, retrodays, UltimateCataclysmDemo
name: TILES

info: Specified the mode in which the memory map is drawn.  Requires restart.
name: MEMORY_MAP_MODE

info: If true, shows the pixel-detail minimap in game after the save is loaded.  Use the 'Toggle Pixel Minimap' action key to change its visibility during gameplay.
name: PIXEL_MINIMAP

info: Specified the mode in which the minimap drawn.
default: Default: dots - Values: solid, squares, dots
name: PIXEL_MINIMAP_MODE

info: Overall brightness of pixel-detail minimap.
name: PIXEL_MINIMAP_BRIGHTNESS

info: Height of pixel-detail minimap, measured in terminal rows.  Set to 0 for default spacing.
name: PIXEL_MINIMAP_HEIGHT

info: Scale pixel minimap to fit its surroundings.  May produce crappy results, especially in modes other than "Solid".
name: PIXEL_MINIMAP_SCALE_TO_FIT

info: Preserves the square shape of tiles shown on the pixel minimap.
name: PIXEL_MINIMAP_RATIO

info: Controls how big the creature beacons are.  Value is in minimap tiles.
name: PIXEL_MINIMAP_BEACON_SIZE

info: Controls how fast the hostile creature beacons blink on the pixel minimap.  Value is multiplied by 200 ms.  Set to 0 to disable.
name: PIXEL_MINIMAP_BLINK

info: Sets which video display will be used to show the game.  Requires restart.
name: DISPLAY

info: Starts Cataclysm in one of the fullscreen modes.  Requires restart.
default: Default: windowedbl - Values: no, maximized, fullscreen, windowedbl
name: FULLSCREEN

info: Set which renderer to use.  Requires restart.
default: Default: direct3d - Values: direct3d, direct3d11, opengl, software
name: RENDERER

info: Use hardware acceleration for the framebuffer when using software rendering.  Requires restart.
name: FRAMEBUFFER_ACCEL

info: If true, tries to use color modulated textures to speed-up ASCII drawing.  Requires restart.
name: USE_COLOR_MODULATED_TEXTURES

info: Sets the scaling mode, 'none' ( default ) displays at the game's native resolution, 'nearest'  uses low-quality but fast scaling, and 'linear' provides high-quality scaling.
default: Default: none - Values: none, nearest, linear
name: SCALING_MODE

info: Factor by which to scale the display.  Requires restart.
name: SCALING_FACTOR

info: Determines the scope, which is known in the beginning of the game.
name: DISTANCE_INITIAL_VISIBILITY

info: Initial points available to spend on stats on character generation.
name: INITIAL_STAT_POINTS

info: Initial points available to spend on traits on character generation.
name: INITIAL_TRAIT_POINTS

info: Initial points available to spend on skills on character generation.
name: INITIAL_SKILL_POINTS

info: Maximum trait points available for character generation.
name: MAX_TRAIT_POINTS

info: Scales experience gained from practicing skills and reading books.  0.5 is half as fast as default, 2.0 is twice as fast, 0.0 disables skill training except for NPC training.
name: SKILL_TRAINING_SPEED

info: Set the level of skill rust.  Vanilla: Vanilla Cataclysm - Capped: Capped at skill levels 2 - Int: Intelligence dependent - IntCap: Intelligence dependent, capped - Off: None at all.
default: Default: off - Values: vanilla, capped, int, intcap, off
name: SKILL_RUST

info: If false, vision is limited to current z-level.  If true and the world is in z-level mode, the vision will extend beyond current z-level.  Currently very bugged!
name: FOV_3D

info: How many levels up and down the experimental 3D field of vision reaches.  (This many levels up, this many levels down.)  3D vision of the full height of the world can slow the game down a lot.  Seeing fewer Z-levels is faster.
name: FOV_3D_Z_RANGE

info: If true, file path names are going to be transcoded from system encoding to UTF-8 when reading and will be transcoded back when writing.  Mainly for CJK Windows users.
name: ENCODING_CONV

info: Handling of game world when last character dies.
default: Default: reset - Values: reset, delete, query, keep
name: WORLD_END

info: A number determining how large cities are.  0 disables cities, roads and any scenario requiring a city start.
name: CITY_SIZE

info: A number determining how far apart cities are.  Warning, small numbers lead to very slow mapgen.
name: CITY_SPACING

info: A scaling factor that determines density of monster spawns.
name: SPAWN_DENSITY

info: A scaling factor that determines how often creatures spawn from rotting material.
name: CARRION_SPAWNRATE

info: A scaling factor that determines density of item spawns.
name: ITEM_SPAWNRATE

info: A scaling factor that determines density of dynamic NPC spawns.
name: NPC_DENSITY

info: A scaling factor that determines the time between monster upgrades.  A higher number means slower evolution.  Set to 0.00 to turn off monster upgrades.
name: MONSTER_UPGRADE_FACTOR

info: Determines the movement rate of monsters.  A higher value increases monster speed and a lower reduces it.  Requires world reset.
name: MONSTER_SPEED

info: Determines how much damage monsters can take.  A higher value makes monsters more resilient and a lower makes them more flimsy.  Requires world reset.
name: MONSTER_RESILIENCE

info: ( WIP feature ) Determines terrain, shops, plants, and more.
name: DEFAULT_REGION

info: Initial starting time of day on character generation.
name: INITIAL_TIME

info: How many days into the year the cataclysm occurred.  Day 0 is Spring 1.  Can be overridden by scenarios.  This does not advance food rot or monster evolution.
name: INITIAL_DAY

info: How many days after the cataclysm the player spawns.  Day 0 is the day of the cataclysm.  Can be overridden by scenarios.  Increasing this will cause food rot and monster evolution to advance.
name: SPAWN_DELAY

info: Season length, in days.  Warning: Very little other than the duration of seasons scales with this value, so adjusting it may cause nonsensical results.
name: SEASON_LENGTH

info: Sets the time of construction in percents.  '50' is two times faster than default, '200' is two times longer.  '0' automatically scales construction time to match the world's season length.
name: CONSTRUCTION_SCALING

info: Keep the initial season for ever.
name: ETERNAL_SEASON

info: Emulation of zombie hordes.  Zombie spawn points wander around cities and may go to noise.  Must reset world directory after changing for it to take effect.
name: WANDER_SPAWNS

info: If true, spawn zombies at shelters.  Makes the starting game a lot harder.
name: BLACK_ROAD

info: If true, static NPCs will spawn at pre-defined locations.  Requires world reset.
name: STATIC_NPC

info: Determines whether starting NPCs should spawn, and if they do, how exactly.
default: Default: scenario - Values: never, always, scenario
name: STARTING_NPC

info: If true, the game will randomly spawn NPCs during gameplay.
name: RANDOM_NPC

info: If true, radiation causes the player to mutate.
name: RAD_MUTATION

info: If true, experimental z-level maps will be enabled.  Turn this off if you experience excessive slowdown.
name: ZLEVELS

info: If true, downstairs will be placed directly above upstairs, even if this results in uglier maps.
name: ALIGN_STAIRS

info: Allowed point pools for character generation.
default: Default: any - Values: any, multi_pool, no_freeform
name: CHARACTER_POINT_POOLS
